34.  The Young's double slit interference experiment is performed using light consisting of 480 nm and 600 nm wavelengths to form interference patterns. The least number of the bright fringes of 480 nm light that are required for the first coincidence with the bright fringes formed by 600 nm light is :-
solution: 1 1  2 2 n  D n  D d d n 480 = m 600 n min = 5

question_text: 43.  A  parallel  plate  capacitor  was  made  with  two rectangular plates, each with a length of l = 3 cm and breath of b = 1 cm. The distance between the plates is 3 µm. Out of the following, which are the ways to increase the capacitance by a factor of 10 ? A. l = 30 cm, b = 1 cm, d = 1 µm B. l = 3 cm, b = 1 cm, d = 30 µm C. l = 6 cm, b = 5 cm, d = 3 µm D. l = 1 cm, b = 1 cm, d = 10 µm E. l = 5 cm, b = 2 cm, d = 1 µm Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

45.  An ideal gas goes from an initial state to final state. During the process, the pressure of gas increases linearly with temperature. A. The work done by gas during the process is zero. B. The heat added to gas is different from change in its internal energy. C. The volume of the gas is increased. D. The internal energy of the gas is increased. E.  The  process  is  isochoric  (constant  volume process) Choose the correct answer from the options given below :-
solution: Given that P = kT = constant P T  Volume is constant or isochoric process.  W D = 0  Q = U Also temperature increases hence internal energy increases. SECTION-B

question_text: 46.  A square loop of sides a = 1 m is held normally in front of a point charge q = 1C. The flux of the electric  field  through  the  shaded  region  is 2 0 5 1 Nm p  C  , where the value of p is ____.
47.  The least count of a screw guage is 0.01 mm. If the pitch is increased by 75% and number of divisions on the circular scale is reduced by 50%, the new least count will be _____ × 10–3 mm.
solution: Given least count of Screw Gauge = 0.01 mm L.C =    = 0.01 mm   pitch P No.of circular turn N New pitch =        P 1  0.75 P 1.75 N 1  0.5 N  0.5     = (0.01) 3.5 = 0.035 mm = 35 × 10–3 mm  Ans. is 35

question_text: 48.  A  wire  of  resistance  9    is  bent  to  form  an equilateral triangle. Then the equivalent resistance across any two vertices will be __ohm.
solution: A 3 3  3 B  C   B  3  C 6 9 is the resistance of whole wire  resistance of each wire = 3.  Equivalent resistance = 2

question_text: 49.  A current of 5A exists in a square loop of side 1 m . Then the magnitude of the magnetic field 2 B  at  the  centre  of  the  square  loop  will  be p × 10–6 T. where, value of p is ______. [Take µ 0 = 4 × 10–7 T mA–1].
solution: 45°  45° i=5A Square loop Let B be the magnetic field due to single side then B  0  sin   sin   4  d 1 2  i    2  10  7  6 10  5  2 1 1 2 2 2  B net at centre O = 4B  = 8 × 10–6  P = 8 Ans.

question_text: 50.  The temperature of 1 mole of an ideal monoatomic gas is increased by 50°C at constant pressure. The total heat added and change in internal energy are E 1 and E 2, respectively. If  1   then the value 2 E x E 9 of x is _______.
solution: Given that process is isobaric T = 50°C Q in isobaric process = nC PT = E 1 U in isobaric process = nC VT = E 2  1  P  2 V E C E C Given, gas is monoatomic    = 1 + 2 f =  1  2 3  = 5 3 Now, as per question.  5 x 3 9 x = 15

question_text: 51. For the given cell Fe2+(eq) + Ag+(aq) Fe3+ (aq) + Ag(s) The standard cell potential of the above reaction is Given : Ag+ + e–  Ag  E0 = xV Fe2+ + 2e– Fe  E0 = y V Fe3+ + 3e– Fe  E0 = zV
solution: Fe2+(aq) + Ag+(aq) Fe3+ (aq) + Ag(s) Fe G 10 Fe+2 G 20 Fe+3 G 30  G 0  G 0  G 0 3 1 2 –3F(–z) = –2F(–y) + G 20 0 2  G  3Fz  2Fy Also   G 0  nFE 0 2  2  3 Fe /Fe Fe  2 /Fe  3 0 3Fz  2Fy  1F(E )  2  3 E 0  2y  3z Fe /Fe 0 Cell E  for reaction will be   2  3 E 0  E 0 Ag /Ag Fe /Fe = x + 2y –3z

question_text: 52. Following are the four molecules "P", "Q", "R" and "S". Which one among the four molecules will react with H-Br(aq) at the fastest rate ? O  O P  Q  R  S CH 3  CH 3 CH 3
solution: Addition of H-Br (aq) to alkene follows electrophilic addition mechanism. In the rate determining step a carbocation intermediate is formed. Among P, Q, R  &  S  compound  Q  will  form  most  stable carbocation  intermediate  since  it  is  resonance stabilized. O  O  O H  

question_text: 53. One mole of the octahedral complex compound Co(NH 3) 5Cl 3 gives 3 moles of ions on dissolution in water. One mole of the same complex reacts with excess of AgNO 3 solution to yield two moles of AgCl (s). The structure of the complex is : 2 3 3 3
solution:        2  3 2 3 5 5 3ionsinwater  Co NH Cl  Cl   Co NH Cl  aq.  2Cl (aq.)     [Co(NH 3) 5Cl]Cl 2(aq.) + 2AgNO 3(aq.)    [Co(NH 3) 5Cl](NO 3) 2(aq.) + 2AgCl(s)

question_text: 54.  Which one of the carbocations from the following is most stable ?  CH 2 +  CH 2  CH 3 + O  CH 2 + O  CH 3 O  CH 2 + F
solution: Carbocation intermediate is stabilised by +I, +M & hyperconjugation  effect.  Since  in  option  2 carbocation  is  in  conjugation  with  stronger  +M group –OCH 3 hence it will be most stable.

question_text: 55.  Which  of  the  following  linear  combination  of atomic orbitals will lead to formation of molecular orbitals  in  homonuclear  diatomic  molecules [internuclear axis in z-direction] ? A. 2p z and 2p x B. 2s and 2p x C.  3d and3d xy x 2  y 2 D. 2s and 2p z E.  2p and3d z 2 2 x  y
solution: A :  X    no molecular orbital  +  X pz  px Z  Z

question_text: 56.  Which  of  the  following  ions  is  the  strongest oxidizing agent ? (Atomic Number of Ce = 58, Eu = 63, Tb = 65, Lu = 71]
57.  Ksp  for Cr(OH) 3 is 1.6 × 10–30. What is the molar solubility of this salt in water?
58.  Let us consider an endothermic reaction which is non-spontaneous  at  the  freezing  point  of  water. However, the reaction is spontaneous at boiling point of water. Choose the correct option.
solution: Reaction  is  spontaneous  at  relatively  high temperature  and  non-spontaneous  at  low temperature G = H – TS It  is  only  possible  when  H  and  S  both  are positive.

question_text: 59.  Given below are two statements I and II. Statement  I  :  Dumas  method  is  used  for estimation of “Nitrogen” in an organic compound. Statement  II  :  Dumas  method  involves  the formation of ammonium sulphate by heating the organic compound with conc H 2SO 4. In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below

options.(1): Both Statement I and Statement II are true
options.(2): Statement I is false but Statement II is true
options.(3): Both Statement I and Statement II are false
options.(4): Statement I is true but Statement II is false

solution: In  Dumas  method  nitrogen  present  in  organic compound  is  converted  into  N 2  gas  whose volumetric  analysis  gives  the  percentage  of nitrogen atom in the organic compound.

question_text: 60.  Which of the following Statements are NOT true about the periodic table? A.  The  properties  of  elements  are  function  of atomic weights. B.  The  properties  of  elements  are  function  of atomic numbers. C.  Elements  having  similar  outer  electronic configuration are arranged in same period. D.  An  element's  location  reflects  the  quantum numbers of the last filled orbital. E. The number of elements in a period is same as the number of atomic orbitals available in energy level that is being filled.

61.  The carbohydrates “Ribose” present in DNA,  is A. A pentose sugar B. present in pyranose from C. in “D” configuration D. a reducing sugar, when free E. in -anomeric form Choose the correct answer from the options given below :
solution: In Ribose carbohydrate present in DNA is -2- Deoxy-D-Ribose whose structure is  H  H  HOCH OH 2  O H OH H  H  which is a reducing D-sugar in  anomeric form & it is a pentose sugar.

question_text: 62.  Preparation  of  potassium  permanganate  from MnO 2 involves two step process in which the 1st step is a reaction with KOH and KNO 3 to produce 4 4
63. The  large  difference  between  the  melting  and boiling  points  of  oxygen  and  sulphur  may  be explained on the basis of
solution: Oxygen exists as O 2 (Atomicity = 2) Sulphur exists as S 8 (Atomicity = 8) Hence, Melting point & Boiling point of sulphur are significantly large compared to oxygen.

He thought  of  performing  ozonolysis  reaction  on alkene to produce a dicarbonyl compound followed by  aldol  reaction  to  prepare  “x”.  Predict  the suitable alkene that can lead to the formation of “x”. CH 3  CH 3 CH 2 CH 3
solution: CH 7 3 O 3 Zn/H 2O/  2 6  5 4 3  1 H O  O   OH/ 1  2  3   6  4  5   3 C CH O  7

question_text: 67.  Consider the given plots of vapour pressure (VP) vs temperature (T/K) Which amongst the following options is correct graphical representation showing T f, depression in the freezing point of solvent in a solution ?  T f Solution  T T f° f T  VP K   T f Liquid Solvent  Solution Frozen T T f f° T K VP  Solution  T f T T f° f T  VP K  Frozen Solution   T f Solution  T f T f° T  VP K
solution: On  adding  non-volatile  solute  in  a  solvent,  the freezing point of solution decreases. T  T 0 f f F.P. of solution < F.P. of pure solvent

question_text: 68.  Which  of  the  following  statement  is  true    with T f T T f f° T K VP  Frozen Solution   respect to H 2O, NH 3 and CH 4?  A. The central atoms of all the molecules are sp3 hybridized. B. The H–O–H, H–N–H and H–C–H angles in the above molecules are 104.5º, 107.5º and 109.5º respectively. C.  The  increasing  order  of  dipole  moment  is CH 4 < NH 3 < H 2O. D.  Both H 2O and NH 3 are Lewis acids and CH 4 is a Lewis base E.  A  solution  of  NH 3  in  H 2O  is  basic.  In  this solution NH 3 and H 2O act as Lowry-Bronsted acid and base respectively. Choose the correct answer from the options given below :

options.(4): A, B, C and E only

question_text: 104.5º  H  H  H O  sp3  N  sp3 C  sp3 H  H  H N  C H  H H
107.5º  109.5º Dipole moment  H 2O > NH 3 > CH 4 H 2O & NH 3 are Lewis Bases NH 3 act as Lowry- Bronsted base Hence, A, B & C are correct

69.  Given below are two statements : Statement-I : The conversion proceeds well in the less polar medium. CH 3–CH 2–CH 2–CH 2–Cl CH HO – 3–CH 2–CH 2– CH 2–OH + Cl– Statement-II : The conversion proceeds well in the more polar medium. CH 3–CH 2–CH 2–CH 2–Cl   CH 3 3–CH 2–CH 2– R N –  CH 2–N–R  Cl(–) R R (+) In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below.

options.(1): Both statement I and statement II are true
options.(2): Both statement I and statement II are false
options.(3): Statement I is false but statement II is true
options.(4): Statement I is true but statement II is false

solution: CH 3 – CH 2 – CH 2 – CH 2 – Cl + OH   SN2 Reactant (higher charge density) HO ………. C  ………. Cl H  H C 3H 7  Transition state (less charge density)  This reaction will proceed faster in less polar medium  which  will  not  increase  the  activation energy value.   CH 3 – CH 2 – CH 2 – CH 2 – Cl + R 3N SN2 Reactant (low charge density) R  Cl 3N ……….  C  ………. H  H C 3H 7 Transition state (Higher charge density) + –   This reaction will proceed faster in more polar medium which will decrease the activation energy value.

solution: 4  CH CH 3 – C – CH 3 – C  CH Hg2+, H 2SO 3 O  HCN  CH 3 – C – CH CH 3 – C – CH 3  3 OH OH  CH 2–NH CN 2 H 2/Ni SECTION-B

question_text: 71.  37.8 g N 2O 5 was taken in a 1 L reaction vessel and allowed to undergo the following reaction at 500 K 2N 2O 5(g)  2N 2O 4(g) + O 2(g) The total pressure at equilibrium was found to be
18.65 bar. Then, Kp = _______ × 10–2 [nearest integer] Assume  N 2O 5  to  behave  ideally  under  these conditions  Given : R = 0.082 bar L mol–1 K–1

73.  Xg of benzoic acid on reaction with aq. NaHCO 3 release CO 2 that occupied 11.2 L volume at STP. X is _____ g.
solution: C 6H 5COOH+NaHCO 3C 6H 5COO–Na+ +H 2O+CO 2 x gm    11.2 L mole of C 6H 5COOH = mole of CO 2 = 11.2  0.5

question_text: 22.4 mass of C 6H 5COOH = x = 0.5 × 122 = 61 gm
